inclusion.criterion: Male and non-pregnant female subjects whose age is ≥ 20 years and ≤ 80.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is willing and capable of complying with all study protocol requirements, including the specified follow-up visits and can be contacted by telephone.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient or his/her authorized legal representative must sign a written informed consent form that has been approved by the local governing Institutional Review Board (IRB)/ Ethics Committee (EC) of the respective clinical site.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is diagnosed with carotid artery stenosis treatable with carotid artery stenting and is considered a high operative risk for CEA.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Symptomatic carotid stenosis ≥ 50% as determined by angiography using NASCET methodology. Symptomatic is defined as ipsilateral transient monocular blindness: amaurosis fugax; ipsilateral carotid transient ischemic attack (TIA), with neurologic symptoms persisting less than 24 hours; or ipsilateral non-disabling stroke within 180 days of the procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Asymptomatic carotid stenosis ≥ 80% as determined by angiography using NASCET methodology.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient has a modified Rankin Scale score of ≤ 2 at the time of informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is willing and able to take dual antiplatelet therapy for a minimum of 30 days.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Target lesion located at the carotid bifurcation and/or proximal internal carotid artery (ICA).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Single de novo or restenotic (post carotid endarterectomy (CEA)) target lesion or severe tandem lesions that can be covered by a single Neuroguard stent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Target lesion length is ≤ 20 mm (for 30 mm stents) or is ≤ 30 mm (for 40 mm stents).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Index vessel diameter (segment covered by the mid-portion of the stent) between 4.0 mm and 6.0 mm at the site of the target lesion.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Distal vessel diameter at the site of filter deployment is between 4.0 mm to 7.0 mm.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Life expectancy of less than one year, cancer with metastatic spread and/or undergoing active chemotherapy treatment, or currently requiring an organ transplantation.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: An evolving, acute, or recent disabling stroke in the last 30 days.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation that requires chronic anticoagulation
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has carotid artery stenosis and is considered a high operative risk for CEA. He is willing to take dual antiplatelet therapy and has a modified Rankin Scale score of ≤ 2.
